original_text:
**INSTITUTION
TRANSPLANT SURGERY
DISCHARGE SUMMARY
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[XXX M ZZZ YYY]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Aug 07 2007]
DISCHARGE DATE :
**DATE[Aug 09 2007]
REASON FOR ADMISSION :
Abdominal pain .
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS :
The patient is a **AGE[in 20s]- year-old gentleman who is status post modified multivisceral transplant for treatment of pseudo-obstruction .
The patient is doing well .
He was admitted now with abdominal pain , nausea , and vomiting .
His workup showed a slight elevation of his amylase and lipase .
An enteroscopy was performed .
It showed normal stomach , duodenum , and jejunum allograft .
Biopsies were taken for the jejunum allograft , and there was no rejection .
The patient did improve his abdominal symptoms and tolerate diet .
Decision was made to discharge the patient home with followup in clinic .
MEDICATIONS AT DISCHARGE :
1. Prograf 8 mg p.o. every other day .
2. Actigall 300 mg p.o. t.i.d.
3. Bactrim Single Strength 1 tablet p.o. q. Monday , Wednesday , and Friday .
4. Sodium bicarbonate 1950 mg p.o. t.i.d.
5. Imodium 30 mL p.o. q.i.d.
6. Clonazepam 0.5 mg p.o. b.i.d.
7. Nystatin 5 mL p.o. , swish and swallow q.i.d.
8. Protonix 40 mg p.o. once a day .
9. Remeron 30 mg p.o. once a day .
10. Trazodone 75 mg p.o. once a day .
11. Slow-Mag 64 mg p.o. t.i.d.
12. Cytovene 500 mg p.o. b.i.d.
13. Prevacid 30 mg p.o. once a day .
14. Percocet 1 tablet p.o. every 6 hours if necessary for pain .
___________________________________
**NAME[XXX M ZZZ YYY]
Dictator :
**NAME[VVV WWW] , M.D.
GC/ak
D :
**DATE[Aug 18 2007] 17:05:57
T :
**DATE[Aug 19 2007] 03:47:31
R :
**DATE[Aug 19 2007] 03:47:31/ak
Job ID :
